page.title: 09FORESTRY
page.content: A quarter of our area is under forest.The Devilla Forest belongs to the Forestry Commission. The whole area of forest is under conifers. They are mainly Sitka Spruce with some Lodge Pole Pine and Larch. The forest was planted in 1923. When felled the trees from this area are supplied to a company called Cable Board. This company is outside Stirling at Cowie.Cable Board use the wood from the forest mainly for chip-board and conti-board. Some Noble Fir and Norway Spruce are grown but these are purely for selling as Christmas Trees. {9.6.hectares are under heath land and {nursery. {17.9 hectares are under agriculture. }
